page.title: 16Government
page.content: Cil Y Cwm Community Council covers one of largest areas in Wales, from borders of Ceredigion to Llanwrda, a total of 7200 hectares. it comprises 13 members and a clerk (all male) and meets 4 times a year. Council responsible for street lighting in Cil-y-Cwm and outlying hamlets, footpath maintenance. It also processes complaints and makes observatios on planning applications which are then forwarded to Dinefwr Borough Counci. It has a very small budget because of areas low rateable value. Dinefwr Borough Council has one councillor responsible for Cil-y -Cwm district. Main responsibilities are housing, refuse collection and issuing of licences. Only one council house remains in area. Four houses, previously owned by council were bought by tenants.
